en.costSavingsIntro: When you run a backend in production, your choice of runtime directly affects how much you pay for compute. Swift on the server (Vapor, Hummingbird, SwiftNIO) typically uses less memory and delivers more requests per core than many popular runtimes. That means you can serve the same traffic on smaller or fewer instances—so your cloud bill drops without sacrificing reliability.
en.costSavingsWhyItMatters: Over a year, choosing a more efficient runtime can cut your server bill by hundreds or thousands of dollars for the same workload. The comparison below is a realistic ballpark for a simple JSON API serving roughly 1–2 million requests per month on a single small cloud instance.
en.costSavingsSubhead: Same workload: a typical API serving about 1–2 million requests per month on one small cloud server.
en.costSavingsTableHowToRead: Memory use drives how big a server you need. Traffic capacity is how many requests one server can handle. Lower memory + higher capacity usually means a lower monthly bill for the same traffic.
en.costSavingsColMemoryHelp: Drives minimum server size; lower = smaller/cheaper server
en.costSavingsColThroughputHelp: How much traffic one server can handle; higher = fewer servers needed
en.costSavingsSwiftMemory: Very low (30–80 MB). One small server is often enough for moderate traffic.
en.costSavingsSwiftThroughput: High. One server can handle heavy traffic; fewer servers needed to scale.
en.costSavingsNodeMemory: Moderate (80–150 MB per process). Typically need a step up in server size.
en.costSavingsNodeThroughput: Good. One server handles solid traffic; may need more servers as traffic grows.
en.costSavingsPythonMemory: Higher (100–250 MB per worker). Often need more RAM for multiple workers.
en.costSavingsPythonThroughput: Good with multiple workers. Often need more or larger servers for same traffic.
en.costSavingsJavaMemory: Highest (200–500 MB typical). Usually requires a larger server from the start.
en.costSavingsJavaThroughput: Good once running. Higher baseline memory means bigger server for same traffic.
en.costSavingsDisclaimer: Actual numbers depend on your app, traffic, database usage, and cloud provider. These figures are illustrative; we can help you estimate costs for your specific workload.
en.costSavingsCta: Partner with us to build backends that cost less to run.
en.costSavingsProductionIntro: Different kinds of products need different server profiles. The table below shows typical workload types at scale—and why an efficient runtime (like Swift on the server) can cut costs and simplify operations without naming any specific products.
en.costSavingsProductionEnterpriseNeeds: Moderate to high traffic; reliability, compliance, and uptime. APIs, content, and integrations.
en.costSavingsProductionEnterpriseWhy: Lower cost per request; smaller fleet for same capacity. Predictable bills as traffic grows.
en.costSavingsProductionMessagingNeeds: Real-time delivery, end-to-end encryption, high concurrency. Many connections per server.
en.costSavingsProductionMessagingWhy: Low memory per connection; high throughput per core. Fewer servers for millions of users.
en.costSavingsProductionVideoNeeds: Signaling, control planes, and coordination. Media may use dedicated infra; APIs still need to scale.
en.costSavingsProductionVideoWhy: Efficient signaling and API layers reduce cost. More capacity per server for control traffic.
en.costSavingsProductionSocialNeeds: Very high request volume, feeds, media metadata, global distribution. Cost per request adds up.
en.costSavingsProductionSocialWhy: High throughput and low memory cut cost per million requests. Smaller fleet at scale.

en.islandHoppersDescription: Island Hoppers is the all-in-one app designed to enhance your travel experience, whether you're a company organizing unforgettable tours or a customer seeking the perfect getaway. For companies, our app streamlines the entire tour management process. Organize and customize your tours effortlessly, communicate directly with tour guides, and keep your customers informed with real-time updates. With Island Hoppers, you can manage bookings, track customer preferences, and ensure every detail is taken care of, allowing you to focus on delivering exceptional experiences. For customers, Island Hoppers offers a diverse range of tour packages tailored to suit various group types, including families, backpackers, and party enthusiasts. Browse through our curated selection of adventures, choose the perfect package that fits your style, and connect with like-minded travelers. Enjoy seamless communication with your tour guides, access essential information, and receive personalized recommendations to make the most of your journey. With Island Hoppers, embark on unforgettable adventures with ease and confidence, knowing that every aspect of your tour is just a tap away!

en.spineTailedKitDescription: PQSRTC aims to deliver a streamlined RTC protocol in Swift, with post-quantum encryption as the default. It is a WebRTC-backed SDK that focuses on providing a modern, safe, and high-performance solution for voice and video applications on both Android and Apple platforms, with shared logic written in Swift.
en.needleTailKitDescription: What is NeedleTailKit? NTK is the core SDK for NeedleTail Client and Server Applications, enabling the creation of beautiful end-to-end encrypted applications. It can be used for various applications beyond messaging. Interested? Contact us to learn more!
en.needleTailIRCDescription: A modern IRC client library for Swift applications. NeedleTailIRC provides a robust, type-safe interface for connecting to IRC servers, handling channels, and managing real-time communication. Built with Swift Concurrency for optimal performance.
en.connectionManagerKitDescription: A comprehensive connection management framework for Swift applications. ConnectionManagerKit simplifies network connectivity, connection pooling, and connection lifecycle management. Perfect for applications requiring reliable network communication.
en.postQuantumSolaceDescription: A post-quantum cryptography library for Swift applications. PostQuantumSolace provides quantum-resistant cryptographic algorithms and protocols, ensuring your applications remain secure in the quantum computing era.
en.doubleRatchetKitDescription: A Swift implementation of the Double Ratchet Algorithm with Post-Quantum X3DH (PQXDH) integration. Provides forward secrecy and post-compromise security for secure messaging—implements the Signal protocol specification with hybrid PQXDH (MLKEM1024 and Curve25519), header encryption, and out-of-order message support. Cross-platform: macOS 15+, iOS 18+, Android, and Linux.
en.whiteTippedSocketsDescription: WhiteTippedSockets is a native WebSocket library for iOS and macOS, built on the Network.framework API using Swift Concurrency. Our goal is to provide a modern, efficient solution for WebSocket communication, and we also plan to develop a fully functional, scalable server in the future.
en.swiftHlsDescription: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) is a key technology for efficient media streaming, and SwiftHLS is designed to facilitate this. Utilizing the same protocol that powers the web, HLS allows content delivery via REST APIs and CDNs. Its purpose is to provide reliability and dynamically adapts to network conditions.
en.swiftIapDescription: SwiftIAP is a comprehensive In-App Purchase library for iOS and macOS applications. It provides a modern, type-safe interface for handling in-app purchases, subscriptions, and receipt validation. Built with Swift Concurrency and designed for ease of use.
en.stompDescription: Stomp is a Swift library for STOMP protocol communication. It provides a modern, type-safe interface for connecting to STOMP servers and handling message routing. Perfect for applications that need reliable messaging infrastructure.
